keyMoments.title: Mr. 7's Debut
keyMoments.description: Mr. 7 appears at the Alubarna clock tower alongside Miss Father's Day, guarding the bomb that threatens to destroy the city. He reveals his Yellow Gun that fires dice-shaped bullets marked with seven dots.
keyMoments.significance: Introduces one of the final Baroque Works agents defending Crocodile's plan. His role as a sniper makes him a formidable opponent for Vivi.

keyMoments.title: Confrontation with Vivi
keyMoments.description: Mr. 7 prepares to engage Princess Vivi in battle at the clock tower, preventing her from reaching the bomb.
keyMoments.significance: Establishes his role as an obstacle in Vivi's desperate race to save her kingdom.

abilities.description: A custom-made flintlock pistol that fires dice-shaped bullets marked with seven dots. Can coordinate shots with Miss Father's Day to create synchronized explosions.

relationships.description: Mr. 7's sniper partner in Baroque Works. They work together as a coordinated duo for assassination missions.

evolutionMoments.description: Mr. 7 and Miss Father's Day work together to guard the bomb at the clock tower.

reveals.information: Member of Baroque Works as a Frontier Agent sniper
Wields the Yellow Gun that fires dice-shaped bullets

name.japanese: ミス・ファーザーズデー

keyMoments.title: Miss Father's Day's Debut
keyMoments.description: Miss Father's Day appears at the Alubarna clock tower with her distinctive frog-themed appearance and her Gero Gero Gun that fires frog-shaped bullets. She laughs with her characteristic 'Gerogerogerogerogero!' laugh.
keyMoments.significance: Introduces the female half of the sniper duo guarding Crocodile's bomb. Her unique frog theme and weaponry make her a memorable character.

keyMoments.title: Confrontation with Vivi
keyMoments.description: Miss Father's Day prepares to fight Princess Vivi alongside Mr. 7 to prevent her from reaching the bomb.
keyMoments.significance: Establishes her role as one of the final obstacles preventing the salvation of Alabasta.

abilities.description: A frog-shaped firearm that fires frog-shaped bullets. Can coordinate shots with Mr. 7 for synchronized attacks.

relationships.description: Miss Father's Day's sniper partner in Baroque Works. They function as a coordinated assassination duo.

evolutionMoments.description: Miss Father's Day and Mr. 7 work together to guard the bomb at the clock tower.

reveals.information: Member of Baroque Works as a Frontier Agent sniper
Wields the Gero Gero Gun that fires frog-shaped bullets
Has a distinctive frog-themed appearance and laugh ('Gerogerogerogerogero!')

keyMoments.title: Using Blood to Strike Crocodile
keyMoments.description: Luffy demonstrates strategic growth by using his own blood to coat his fists, allowing him to strike Crocodile's Logia sand body without water.
keyMoments.significance: Shows Luffy's tactical evolution and problem-solving abilities. This creative solution to overcome a seemingly invincible enemy foreshadows his future adaptability in combat.
keyMoments.quote: Water wasn't the only thing that could harden your sand!

keyMoments.title: Poisoned by Crocodile's Hook
keyMoments.description: Luffy is struck by Crocodile's poison hook and infected with scorpion venom, but continues fighting despite the poison spreading through his body.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates Luffy's extraordinary willpower and hints at his unusual resistance to toxins. Crocodile notes confusion about why the venom isn't as effective as expected.

abilities.description: Luffy uses his own blood to coat his fists and body, allowing him to strike and grab Crocodile's sand body effectively. This technique hardens the sand similar to water but can be sustained during combat.

reveals.information: Discovers that blood can harden Crocodile's sand, allowing him to damage a Logia user without Haki
Shows unusual resistance to Crocodile's scorpion venom, with the poison working slower than expected

keyMoments.title: Reveals Poison Hook
keyMoments.description: Crocodile removes the golden covering from his hook to reveal a hidden poisonous hook underneath, which he uses against Luffy as a mark of respect for a worthy opponent.
keyMoments.significance: Reveals another layer of Crocodile's combat abilities and shows his twisted sense of honor. The poison hook is one of his rarely-seen weapons reserved for opponents he deems worthy.
keyMoments.quote: You've earned the right to die by my most deadly weapon.

abilities.description: A hidden poisonous hook concealed beneath the gold covering of Crocodile's prosthetic hook. Contains deadly scorpion venom that spreads through the victim's body upon contact.

reveals.information: Possesses a hidden poison hook beneath his golden hook covering, filled with scorpion venom
Shows a measure of respect for Luffy by using his poison hook, which he considers an honorable weapon for worthy opponents

keyMoments.title: Discovers the Bomb Location
keyMoments.description: Using her childhood memories and knowledge of Alubarna, Vivi deduces that the bomb must be hidden in the clock tower and races there to stop it.
keyMoments.significance: Showcases Vivi's intelligence and deep knowledge of her kingdom. Her deduction is crucial to having any chance of stopping the bomb.
keyMoments.quote: The clock tower! That's the only place it could be!

keyMoments.title: Confronts Mr. 7 and Miss Father's Day
keyMoments.description: Despite being outmatched, Vivi prepares to fight trained Baroque Works assassins to reach the bomb and save her kingdom.
keyMoments.significance: Demonstrates Vivi's growth from passive royalty to active hero willing to risk her life. Shows her determination to save Alabasta by any means necessary.
keyMoments.quote: I won't let you destroy my country!

reveals.information: Demonstrates tactical intelligence by using childhood memories to deduce the bomb's location
Shows willingness to directly engage in combat against trained assassins to save her kingdom
